opt.history.recorder#

Main implementation of the recorder.

Module Contents#

Classes#

ArtifactCollection

A dict with additional forced attribute.

HistoryEntryWithArtifacts

A history entry enhanced with artifacts.

HistoryEntry

A history entry storing call number, parameters and target function value.

SimpleRecorder

A basic recorder that stores history entries.

SimpleRecorderWithGradient

A recorder saving history entries that works with callables with gradient.

ArtifactRecorder

A recorder saving history entries with artifacts.

ArtifactRecorderWithGradient

A recorder storing history entries with artifacts supporting callables with

opt.history.recorder.NATIVE_RECORDER_ATTRIBUTES = ['predicate', 'history', 'target', 'call_number', 'gradient']#
class opt.history.recorder.ArtifactCollection#

Bases: dict

A dict with additional forced attribute.

The forced flag is set whenever an artifact is forced into the dictionary despite current save_condition being false.

forced :bool = False#
class opt.history.recorder.HistoryEntryWithArtifacts#

Bases: NamedTuple

A history entry enhanced with artifacts.

call_number :int#
params :Any#
value :Any#
artifacts :Dict[str, Any]#
class opt.history.recorder.HistoryEntry#

Bases: NamedTuple

value :Any#
opt.history.recorder.copy_recorder(recorder_to_copy)#

class opt.history.recorder.SimpleRecorder(target: Callable[[S], T], save_condition: opt.api.save_conditions.SaveCondition)#

Bases: Generic[S, T]

A basic recorder that stores history entries.

Parameters

  • target â€“ a target function. Calls to the recorder will be propagated to this function.

  • save_condition â€“ a function determining whether given call should be saved to the history. See respective protocol for explanation of this parameter.

class opt.history.recorder.SimpleRecorderWithGradient(target: opt.api.functions.CallableWithGradient, save_condition: opt.api.save_conditions.SaveCondition)#

Bases: SimpleRecorder

A recorder saving history entries that works with callables with gradient.

Except having gradient attribute, this recorder is the same as SimpleRecorder.

class opt.history.recorder.ArtifactRecorder(target: opt.api.functions.CallableStoringArtifacts[S, T], save_condition: opt.api.save_conditions.SaveCondition)#

Bases: Generic[S, T]

A recorder saving history entries with artifacts.

Parameters to initializer are the same as for SimpleRecorder, except the target function should now be capable of storing artifacts.

class opt.history.recorder.ArtifactRecorderWithGradient(target: opt.api.functions.CallableWithGradientStoringArtifacts, save_condition: opt.api.save_conditions.SaveCondition)#

Bases: ArtifactRecorder

A recorder storing history entries with artifacts supporting callables with gradient.

opt.history.recorder.store_artifact(artifacts) → opt.api.functions.StoreArtifact#

Create a function storing artifacts in given artifacts collection.

Parameters

artifacts â€“ artifact collection.

Returns

_store(artifact_name: str, artifact: Any, force: bool = False) -> None: This function is intended to be passed to functions that are capable of storing artifacts.

Return type

A function with signature

opt.history.recorder.AnyRecorder#
opt.history.recorder.RecorderFactory#
opt.history.recorder.AnyHistory#
opt.history.recorder.recorder(function: opt.api.functions.CallableWithGradientStoringArtifacts, save_condition: opt.api.save_conditions.SaveCondition = always) → ArtifactRecorderWithGradient#
opt.history.recorder.recorder(function: opt.api.functions.CallableStoringArtifacts[S, T], save_condition: opt.api.save_conditions.SaveCondition = always) → ArtifactRecorder[S, T]
opt.history.recorder.recorder(function: opt.api.functions.CallableWithGradient, save_condition: opt.api.save_conditions.SaveCondition = always) → SimpleRecorderWithGradient
opt.history.recorder.recorder(function: Callable[[S], T], save_condition: opt.api.save_conditions.SaveCondition = always) → SimpleRecorder[S, T]

Create a recorder that is suitable for recording calls to given callable.

Parameters

  • function â€“ a callable to be recorded.

  • save_condition â€“ a condition on which the calls will be saved. See SaveCondition protocol for explanation of this parameter. By default all calls are saved.

Returns

A callable object (the recorder) wrapping the function. The return type depends on the passed callable. See overloads defined above to check for available variants. Here is a summary: - recorder is always callable - if function has gradient, so does the recorder. Calls to gradient

and calls made by gradient are NOT recorded.

  • if function has possibility to store artifacts (i.e. accepts store_artifact argument, then so does the recorder.
